content:
Sure, here are the steps to restore an IAM user policy in AWS for a storage security policy:

1. Log in to the AWS Management Console and navigate to the IAM service.
2. In the navigation pane, click on the "Policies" menu.
3. Search for the policy you want to restore and click on its name to open the details page.
4. Click on the "Actions" button and select "Restore Policy Version".
5. A dialog box will appear asking you to confirm the restoration. Click "Yes, Restore" to proceed.
6. The policy will be restored to its previous version.
7. After restoring the policy, you can attach it to the IAM user, group, or role that needs access to the storage service.
8. Finally, test the access to the storage service and ensure that the policy is working as expected.

Please note that these steps are general and the specific steps may vary based on the services and the version of AWS you are using.
